oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Briscoe. Lazy Luke cartoon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: W. Russell Briscoe
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: W.R. (William Russell) Briscoe (1899-1979) panel cartoon entitled "Lazy Luke.". For most of his life, Russell Briscoe lived and worked in Knoxville, TN. He joined the Marines during World War I and was stationed in Washington, D.C. He was co-owner with his wife of Bristoy toy company in the 1930s and he was an executive vice president of the J.E. Lutz Insurance Company. He began painting at age 57 and produced 75 painting, most of historic subjects in East Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cartoons (Working drawings);
